revised_title: Observations of Frost and Its Effects on Liquids and Health
tldr: During a severe frost, the author observed the freezing of various liquids and their effects on health. The frost caused eggs to crack and liquors to turn into solid cakes of ice. The author also tested the freezing point of quicksilver in a frigorific mixture, but it remained fluid below the film on top. The sudden change in temperature led to the disappearance of an epidemic cold and the re-appearance of rheumatic affections and other diseases of the previous milder season.
